author: m0_ox
content:
Hey all. Not sure what is meant by "yellow `stateRoot`" here: https://ethereum-tests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/blockchain-tutorial.html#tests-using-the-blockchain-random-value nor what to do in these new test cases.

Trying to run these against a `py-evm` merge branch and all genesis + single block tests pass but genesis + multi-block tests fail because the `stateRoot` mismatch leads to differing block hashes + conflicts with expected `parentHash` of the next block.

author: dimitry8570
content: That is for test generation. When you use opcode random/difficulty and store its return value in the state it affects the state root. Now if you want a particular difficulty or random value overwritten for the test purposes, retesteth doesn't  know the state root, so you have to overwrite the stateroot too, the correct value will be returned by the client when filling the test

author: dimitry8570
content: That stateRoot value you put to overwrite section

author: dimitry8570
content: When running the test none of this is needed. You must match the block stateroot

author: dimitry8570
content: Check that you implemented random opcode correctly.
